job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: <p>Core Responsibilities:&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Development and implementation of state of the art statistical and machine learning models to enable predictive and prescriptive strategies</li><li>Develop and improve performance models using machine learning for any instrumented piece of equipment and buildings, including specific components/subsystems (compressors, heat exchangers, pumps, coils and/or fans).</li><li>Develop and enhance data driven models to support building models calibration, uncertainty and sensitivity analyses.</li><li>Develop and implement forecasting and prediction strategies, to enhance the quality of physics based models.</li><li>Provide recommendations and selection on the optimized data visualization capabilities, for a given data set</li><li>Test and evaluate the quality of algorithms using statistical methods.</li><li>Interface with engineers and modelers to create and improve understanding of predictive and descriptive models.</li><li>Network across the organization to identify and communicate opportunities to apply data science and machine learning to product design and processes</li><li>Mentor and guide other team members and colleagues in the domain area.</li><li>Promote the use of data based modeling and simulation within the organization via value benefit analysis and similar demonstrations.</li><li>Develop and maintain external collaborations to build and leverage cutting-edge capabilities. Participate and present in internal and external forums and conferences, related to data science and analytics.</li><li>Document work per established internal standards and suggest improvements to procedures.</li><li>Develop a clear understanding of customer requirements and meet or exceed those expectations.</li><li>Conceptualize &amp; develop project ideas leading to new advanced capability development in related domain areas to keep TT to the leading edge of technology.</li><li>Lead internal tactical and strategic projects and reports project progress for quality, deliverables and cost.</li><li>Potential future travel up to 5-10%</li></ul><p>Qualifications:</p><ul><li>Master's Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or Statistics</li><li>3+ years of experience applying data-driven modeling</li><li>Demonstrated work or educational history in engineering and/or engineering related disciplines, including but not limited to differential equations, heat transfer, electrical engineering, controls, HVAC, IoT or embedded technologies highly preferred</li><li>Leadership experience is a plus</li></ul><p>Key Competencies:</p><ul><li>Intermediate knowledge in at least two of the following technologies: R, Python, SQL, MATLAB and ability to adapt to new technologies, as necessary.&nbsp;Familiarity with tools such as Alteryx, SAS, Tableau, RapidMiner is a plus.</li><li>Understanding of engineering data and physics-based models and simulations.</li><li>Sufficient knowledge of machine learning modeling techniques, and experience visualizing model outputs for engineers, customers and stakeholders.</li><li>Communicate compellingly.&nbsp;Convert insights from analytics to stories.&nbsp;Be an advocate for data science and machine learning, and how to create new capabilities and drive transformation.&nbsp;</li><li>Experience in statistical inference, unsupervised machine learning, supervised machine learning, reliability/survivability models, and/or predictive maintenance.&nbsp;Basic experience with neural nets, cross validation, hyperparameter tuning is desired.</li><li>Good understanding of large-scale data mining and machine learning techniques for clustering, classification, regression, and anomaly detection.</li><li>Ability to manipulate and visualize both structured and non-structured datasets.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of database systems including relational, column store and data marts</li><li>Strong written &amp; verbal English communication skills to interface effectively with team members, customers and stakeholders (senior leaders) in North America and other parts of the world.</li></ul><p></p>
